text: <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Promotes LPS - inducible Murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Proximal Promoter Activity

Since <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds to the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proximal promoter in an LPS - inducible manner both in vitro and in vivo , we wanted to address the question of whether <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was an essential factor for driving transcription from the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in cells in response to LPS .

The ability of endogenous <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to direct transcription from the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proximal promoter was examined by transfection of the pGLmP-539 murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 luciferase reporter <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> construct into <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + and <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - MEFs .

We found that LPS - stimulated <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity was significantly increased in <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + MEFs and abrogated in <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - MEFs ( Fig . 8A ) , indicating that endogenous <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is required for LPS - induced <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proximal promoter activity .
